hero.p1: A dedicated Web Developer passionate about the tech industry and its endless possibilities.

missionStatement.p1: I'm driven to build tools and applications that genuinely improve how people work, live, and interact with technology.
missionStatement.p2: I've been immersed in tech since childhood — I built my first computer at 9 with my dad, and I’ve been hooked ever since.
missionStatement.p3: From building full-stack applications with the MERN stack to developing a professional-level understanding of operating systems, I’ve always loved automating tasks and crafting practical solutions.
missionStatement.p4: Seeing people use and benefit from what I build is what keeps me going. It’s deeply satisfying — and I love every part of the process.

journey.p1: I started my software development career by building full-stack applications with the MERN stack, which gave me a solid foundation in modern web technologies.

descriptions: I completed a web development bootcamp at UCI in Irvine, where I learned to build full-stack applications using the MERN stack.
During that time, I co-developed RoshiHealth, a wellness app that helped users track health goals. I worked on the front end using React.js, while our backend used Node.js and MongoDB.
After that, I began building a social media platform using Next.js and MongoDB, shifting my focus from syntax to architecture and project structure.
I also earned my CompTIA A+ certification and began exploring how networking ties into software development.
After moving to Minnesota, I joined MCSI as a Junior Developer, where I contributed to internal tools and client-facing web applications using JavaScript and the CMS platform joomla.
At GreatWoods Cabinetry, I was hired to build a custom order management system while also handling network infrastructure and hardware troubleshooting across the company.
I worked at TDX Technologies to support and maintain client networks, focusing on software troubleshooting, system recovery, and diagnostics across Windows environments.
At UptimeLegal, I served as a Tier 3 Software Support Engineer, specializing in complex issue resolution, automation, and system optimization across law firm platforms and server infrastructure.
Alongside this role, I’ve been building production-level web apps and internal tools using React and Node.js, further refining my full-stack development skill set.

uxPhilosophy.p1: I believe successful applications should be simple, effective, and intuitive. A great program makes tasks easier and helps users accomplish them without friction.

whatDrivesMe.p1: I'm passionate about technology and always exploring new ideas. I love to learn, build, and take on challenges that push my skills forward.
whatDrivesMe.p2: I'm especially excited by developments in AI and hardware innovation — I can't wait to help shape that future.

thankYou.p1: Thank you for exploring my UX programming portfolio and getting to know me better. I'm excited about the opportunity to collaborate with you and contribute to creating exceptional digital experiences.
